str2: In like manner, likewise, just so. From hos and an adverb from autos; as thus, i.e. In the same way.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
To dine, sup, eat. From deipnon; to dine, i.e. Take the principle meal.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
This; he, she, it.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
This; he, she, it.
As often as, as many times as. Multiple adverb from hos; how many times as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A recalling, remembrance, memory. From anamimnesko; recollection.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
